message:
The commander of the American Central Command is again in Israel

IDF Spokesperson: The Commander of the U.S. Central Command (CENTCOM) General (* * * *) Michael Erik Kurilla landed in Israel yesterday (Thursday) for his second visit this week, as the official guest of the Chief of the General Staff, LTG Herzi Halevi. 

The Chief of the General Staff and the Commander of the U.S Central Command held a situational assessment on security and strategic issues, as well as joint preparations in the region, as part of the response to threats in the Middle East.  
Additionally, General Kurilla visited the Underground Air Force Operations Center and held a situational assessment with the Commanding Officer of the Israeli Air Force, Maj. Gen. Tomer Bar. 

The IDF will continue to deepen its relationship with the U.S. Armed Forces out of commitment to strengthening regional stability and coordination between the two militaries.

Palestinian channels report that this morning, the IDF dropped leaflets in Gaza offering a cash reward and complete confidentiality to anyone who provides information on senior Hamas officials. 

The leaflet also stated that the elimination of the Hamas movement is a decided matter.

Residents of South Lebanon report that yesterday and today, the IDF sent drones to Bint Jbeil, broadcasting a recording through loudspeakers with "inciting messages" against Nasrallah and Hezbollah: 

"It's all because of Hezbollah and Nasrallah..."

This is what an exiled Gazan wrote on Facebook this morning:

"The appointment of Sinwar, the disappearance of the movement's spokespeople, the effective cessation of the Hamas government in Gaza, alongside the capitulation of the 'Captagon Axis' (the Shiite axis - AA) to escalation and the adoption of the 'Ya Wash Ya Wash' strategy ('slowly, slowly' - a quote from Nasrallah's latest speech - AA) — simply mean that everything has collapsed. 

The myth that has been exploited for 17 years (since Hamas's rise in Gaza - AA) under bombastic slogans has crumbled... Fallen, like a house of cards. Gaza has nothing left but its own residents. They are alone. Alone with themselves... They must now figure out how to escape the tunnel they've been driven into by these bastards..."
The Palestinians report that the IDF has placed a crane with a system of cameras and an automatic machine gun at the top of it in the Qarara area, north of Khan Yunis.

Following the evacuation of the population yesterday in Khan Yunis, a popular Gaza channels (tens of thousands of followers) wrote the following manifesto last night:

Khan Yunis is vacating... Beit Hanoun is vacating... Jabaliya is vacating.... Rafah is empty.... Shejaiya - if you throw a needle there you will be able to hear its noise... Nasser Hospital (Khan Younis) receives martyrs.... Shuhada Al Aqsa Hospital receives body parts.... Al Ahli Hospital receives martyrs and wounded.... Indonesian Hospital - closed.. .. Al-Awda Hospital is calling for help.... and the Gazan citizen, he has no way to pay for the evacuation... he has no tent.... he has nothing to eat...

How long will the lives of Gazans remain so? The people walk down the street and cry... women carry their children with tears running down their faces, grown people carry elderly people on their backs and cry... children hold things they managed to steal and run away...

How long will the situation remain so? May Allah avenge you.
The Lebanese Ministry of Health: Two killed in an Israeli drone attack this morning at 06:30 in Naqoura in southern Lebanon.

Documentation of one of the attacks yesterday👆 in Sheikh Nasser area in Khan Yunis. The impressive documentation indicates that the target of the attack received an evacuation warning in advance (knock on the roof).

Following the evacuation notice to the residents of Khan Yunis yesterday, the IDF spokesman reports this morning about the start of a divisional operation led by the 98th Brigade against Hamas in Khan Yunis.
Official sources identified with the Iranian axis reported three American-British attacks last night in the Salif area, north of Hodeidah, an area under the control of the Houthis in Yemen.

The attack last night in Syria

The Syrian Ministry of Defense confirms that Israel attacked a number of military sites in central Syria last night and as a result 4 Syrian soldiers were injured and property was damaged.

##
Unofficial sources identified with the Assad regime "excuse" the lack of a significant reaction by the Syrian air defense systems last night by saying that there is a "hole in the defense" in this area following the "exhaustion" that the Syrian air defense system has undergone since 2021 (the Air Defense Forces) with an emphasis on the Homs and Tartus area .
According to these sources, there are large gaps in the coverage of the Syrian air defense system in Damascus, Aleppo and Latakia as a result of the many Israeli attacks in recent years on the Buk batteries, the Pantsir and Pechora batteries of the Syrian army as well as on the radar systems.

A joint statement tonight to the President of the USA, the President of Egypt and the Ruler of Qatar:

They call for the renewal of negotiations for a deal between Israel and Hamas on the 14th or 15th of the month in Doha or Cairo.
If necessary, the mediators will make a final offer so that the parties reach an agreement.

##
Prime Minister Netanyahu's office reported that an Israeli delegation would go to the talks following the announcement.

In the background of things - as an additional lever of pressure, they are trying to sell to Israel that reaching a deal may stop the Iranian reaction or that of Hezbollah.

Further to what is happening in northeastern Syria👆👆
The Lebanese Al-Akhbar reports that the US has sent reinforcements of personnel and military equipment to the bases in Omar gas and oil fields and their location in Deir ez-Zur in northeastern Syria, against the background of the progress of the Arab tribes in occupying territories held by the Kurds.

American bloggers involved in the field of aviation:
VFA 25 squadron of type fighter aircraft F/A-18E “Super Hornet” landed a few days ago at the "Muwaffaq Salti Air Base" air base in Jordan.

This morning's headline in the Lebanese Al-Akhbar newspaper, which is affiliated with Hezbollah:
Cyprus surrenders to the US, the island has become an interception platform against Iran and Hezbollah. Unprecedented US military equipment and an aerial train between Larnaca, Paphos and Tel Aviv.
